qas.question: Dead animals that died as a result of natural causes or non-fatal injuries are called?
Why are species can be difficult to classify because they?

answers.text: eat from multiple levels of the food chain

qas.question: What are plants that eat both living species and consume sunlight for energy called?
What are organisms called that show carnivory and herbivory?
What can make classification of predators problematic when using a food pyramid?

answers.text: Many organisms (of which humans are prime examples) eat from multiple levels of the food chain

qas.question: Why would carnivourous plants be difficult to classify into a food pyramid?

answers.text: producing their own food but also digesting anything that they may trap

qas.question: Would it be easy or difficult to classify organims that eat parasites in a food pyramid?
From how many levels of the food chain do parasites usually eat?
What is difficult because parasites eat from more than one food pyramid level?
What are parasites also known as since they eat from more than one level?
What is the nature of the giant panda when its cornered?
What is one thing that giant pandas usually like to eat daily?

context: <a4_0>Many organisms (of which humans are prime examples) <a1_0>eat from <b7_0>multiple<b7_0/> levels of the food chain<a4_0/><a1_0/> and, thus, make this <b8_0>classification<b8_0/> problematic. A carnivore may eat both secondary and tertiary consumers, and its prey may itself be difficult to classify for similar reasons. Organisms showing both carnivory and herbivory are known as <a3_0><b9_0>omnivores<b9_0/><a3_0/>. Even herbivores such as the giant panda may supplement their diet with meat. Scavenging of <a0_0>carrion<a0_0/> provides a significant part of the diet of some of the most <b10_0>fearsome<b10_0/> predators. <a2_0>Carnivorous plants<a2_0/> would be very difficult to fit into this classification, <a5_0>producing their own food but also digesting anything that they may trap<a5_0/>. Organisms that eat <b11_0>detritivores<b11_0/> or parasites would also be <a6_0>difficult<a6_0/> to classify by such a scheme.
